trans-unit.source: You will sometimes see older books or documentation mention "blessing a reference" or describe an object as a "blessed reference", but this is incorrect. It isn't the reference that is blessed as an object; it's the thing the reference refers to (i.e. the referent).

trans-unit.source: You would do well to understand that the TIEARRAY and TIEHASH interfaces are mere sugar to invoke some perl method calls while using the uniform hash and array syntax. The use of this sugar imposes some overhead (typically about two to four extra opcodes per FETCH/STORE operation, in addition to the creation of all the mortal variables required to invoke the methods). This overhead will be comparatively small if the TIE methods are themselves substantial, but if they are only a few statements long, the overhead will not be insignificant.
trans-unit.target: 你最好明白,TIEARRAY和TIEHASH接口只是一个糖,用来调用一些perl方法,同时使用统一的哈希和数组语法。这种糖的使用会带来一些开销(通常每个FETCH/STORE操作会有两到四个额外的操作码,此外还要创建调用方法所需的所有凡人变量)。如果TIE方法本身就很可观,那么这个开销就会相对较小,但如果这些方法只有几条语句长,那么这个开销就不小了。

trans-unit.source: You'll have to catch the SIGCHLD signal, and possibly SIGPIPE too. SIGCHLD is sent when the backgrounded process finishes. SIGPIPE is sent when you write to a filehandle whose child process has closed (an untrapped SIGPIPE can cause your program to silently die). This is not an issue with system("cmd&").
trans-unit.target: 您必须捕获SIGCHLD信号，并且可能还捕获SIGPIPE。后台进程完成时发送SIGCHLD。当您写入其子进程已关闭的文件句柄时，将发送SIGPIPE（未捕获的SIGPIPE可能导致您的程序无声地死掉）。这不是 system("cmd&") 。

trans-unit.source: You're confusing the purpose of system() and backticks (``). system() runs a command and returns exit status information (as a 16 bit value: the low 7 bits are the signal the process died from, if any, and the high 8 bits are the actual exit value). Backticks (``) run a command and return what it sent to STDOUT.
trans-unit.target: 您混淆了 system() 和反引号（``）的用途。 system() 运行命令并返回退出状态信息（作为16位值：低7位是进程退出的信号（如果有），高8位是实际退出值）。反引号（``）运行命令并将其发送给STDOUT的命令返回。

trans-unit.source: Your Chinese translator emails right back -- he says both of these phrases translate to the same thing in Chinese, because, in linguistic jargon, Chinese "doesn't have number as a grammatical category" -- whereas English does. That is, English has grammatical rules that refer to "number", i.e., whether something is grammatically singular or plural; and one of these rules is the one that forces nouns to take a plural suffix (generally "s") when in a plural context, as they are when they follow a number other than "one" (including, oddly enough, "zero"). Chinese has no such rules, and so has just the one phrase where English has two. But, no problem, you can have this one Chinese phrase appear as the translation for the two English phrases in the "zh" gettext lexicon for your program.
trans-unit.target: 你的中文翻译马上回邮件--他说这两个短语在中文里翻译成的都是一样的东西,因为用语言学的行话来说,中文 "没有数字这个语法范畴"--而英语有。也就是说,英语有指 "数 "的语法规则,即某事物在语法上是单数还是复数;而其中一条规则就是,当名词在复数语境中时,强制名词带复数后缀(一般是 "s"),因为它们在 "一 "以外的数字后面(包括,奇怪的是,"零")也是如此。汉语没有这样的规则,所以只有一个短语,而英语有两个。但是,没问题,你可以让这一个中文短语作为两个英文短语的翻译出现在你的程序的 "zh "gettext词库中。

trans-unit.source: Your module may be object oriented (OO) or not, or it may have both kinds of interfaces available. There are pros and cons of each technique, which should be considered when you design your API.
trans-unit.target: 你的模块可能是面向对象(OO)的,也可能不是,或者它可能有两种接口可用。每种技术都有优点和缺点,当你设计API时,应该考虑到这一点。

trans-unit.source: Your module should also include a README file describing the module and giving pointers to further information (website, author email).
trans-unit.target: 你的模块还应该包含一个README文件,描述该模块,并提供进一步的信息(网站、作者邮箱)。

trans-unit.source: Your module should have a clearly defined scope which is no longer than a single sentence. Can your module be broken down into a family of related modules?
trans-unit.target: 您的模块应该有一个明确定义的范围,不超过一句话。您的模块是否可以分解成一个相关模块的家族?

trans-unit.source: Your module should include documentation aimed at Perl developers. You should use Perl's "plain old documentation" (POD) for your general technical documentation, though you may wish to write additional documentation (white papers, tutorials, etc) in some other format. You need to cover the following subjects:
trans-unit.target: 你的模块应该包括针对 Perl 开发者的文档。你应该使用Perl的 "老式文档"(POD)来编写一般的技术文档,尽管你可能希望用其他格式来编写额外的文档(白皮书、教程等)。你需要涵盖以下主题。

trans-unit.source: Your module should run successfully under the strict pragma and should run without generating any warnings. Your module should also handle taint-checking where appropriate, though this can cause difficulties in many cases.
trans-unit.target: 您的模块应该在strict pragma下成功运行,并且应该在不产生任何警告的情况下运行。您的模块也应该在适当的时候处理污点检查,尽管这在很多情况下会造成困难。

trans-unit.source: Your module will be part of a developer's toolkit. It will not, in itself, form the entire toolkit. It's tempting to add extra features until your code is a monolithic system rather than a set of modular building blocks.
trans-unit.target: 您的模块将成为开发人员工具包的一部分。它本身不会构成整个工具箱。诱人的是要添加额外的功能，直到您的代码是单片系统而不是一组模块化构建块。

trans-unit.source: Your name for distributing the package with the version number included. This is used by 'make dist' to name the resulting archive file.
trans-unit.target: 你用来发布包含版本号的软件包的名称。这将被'make dist'用来命名生成的存档文件。

trans-unit.source: Your naming should be consistent. For instance, it's better to have:
trans-unit.target: 你的命名应该是一致的。比如说,最好有。

trans-unit.source: Your patch may be returned with requests for changes, or requests for more detailed explanations about your fix.
trans-unit.target: 您的补丁可能会被退回,要求更改,或要求对您的修复进行更详细的解释。

trans-unit.source: Your random numbers are not that random
trans-unit.target: 你的随机数不是那么随机的

trans-unit.source: Your return address. The program will ask you to confirm its default if you don't use this option.
trans-unit.target: 您的返回地址。如果你不使用这个选项,程序会要求你确认它的默认地址。

trans-unit.source: Your script will declare a skip with the reason why you skipped and exit immediately with a zero (success). See Test::Harness for details.
trans-unit.target: 您的脚本将声明一个跳过，并说明您跳过的原因，并立即以零（成功）退出。有关详细信息，请参见Test :: Harness。

trans-unit.source: Your script will declare a skip with the reason why you skipped and exit immediately with a zero (success). See Test::Harness for details.

trans-unit.source: Your subpattern can be just about anything, but for it to have some utility, it should match when called with either or both of a) the full name of the property value with underscores (and/or spaces in the Block property) and some things uppercase; or b) the property value in all lowercase with spaces and underscores squeezed out. For example,
trans-unit.target: 你的子模式可以是任何东西,但为了让它有一定的实用性,它应该在调用时与以下两种情况中的任何一种或两种相匹配:a)属性值的全名带有下划线(和/或块属性中的空格)和一些东西的大写;或 b)属性值的全名带有小写,并挤掉空格和下划线。例如
您的 clock(3) ， clock_gettime(2) ， clock_getres(3) ， clock_nanosleep(3) ， clock_settime(2) ， getitimer(2) ， gettimeofday(2) ， setitimer(2) ， sleep(3) ， stat(2) 系统文档（2）， ualarm(3) 。
您的 clock ， clock_gettime ， clock_getres ， clock_nanosleep ， clock_settime ， getitimer ， gettimeofday ， setitimer ， sleep ， stat ， ualarm 的系统文档。

trans-unit.source: Your system may also have man pages installed for those modules, in which case you can probably just use the man(1) command.
trans-unit.target: 你的系统可能还安装了这些模块的手册,在这种情况下,你可以直接使用 man(1)命令。

trans-unit.source: Your system may use lockfiles to control multiple access. Make sure you follow the correct protocol. Unpredictable behavior can result from multiple processes reading from one device.
trans-unit.target: 您的系统可能会使用锁文件来控制多个访问。确保您遵循正确的协议。从一个设备读取多个进程会导致不可预测的行为。

trans-unit.source: [10] Perl has \X and \b{gcb}. Unicode has retracted their "Grapheme Cluster Mode", and recently added string properties, which Perl does not yet support.
trans-unit.target: [10] Perl具有 \X 和 \b{gcb} 。Unicode已撤回其“ Grapheme群集模式”，并且最近添加了Perl不支持的字符串属性。
[12]请参见上面的“属性值中的通配符”。

trans-unit.source: [13] Perl supports all the properties in the Unicode Character Database (UCD). It does not yet support the listed properties that come from other Unicode sources.
trans-unit.target: [13] Perl支持Unicode字符数据库（UCD）中的所有属性。它尚不支持来自其他Unicode来源的列出的属性。

trans-unit.source: [14] The only optional property that Perl supports is Named Sequence. None of these properties are in the UCD.
trans-unit.target: [14] Perl支持的唯一可选属性是“命名序列”。这些属性均不在UCD中。

trans-unit.source: [1] ja: Ideographs are sorted in JIS X 0208 order. Fullwidth and halfwidth forms are identical to their regular form. The difference between hiragana and katakana is at the 4th level, the comparison also requires (variable => 'Non-ignorable'), and then katakana_before_hiragana has no effect.
trans-unit.target: [1] ja：表意文字按JIS X 0208的顺序排序。全角和半角形式与常规形式相同。平假名和片假名之间的差异在第4级，比较也需要 (variable => 'Non-ignorable') ，然后 katakana_before_hiragana 无效。

trans-unit.source: [2] \p{...}\P{...}. This requirement is for a minimal list of properties. Perl supports these. See R2.7 for other properties.
trans-unit.target: [2] \p{...} \P{...} 。此要求是对属性的最小列表。Perl支持这些。有关其他属性，请参见R2.7。

trans-unit.source: [2] ko: Plenty of ideographs are sorted by their reading. Such an ideograph is primary (level 1) equal to, and secondary (level 2) greater than, the corresponding hangul syllable.
trans-unit.target: [2] ko：大量表意文字按其阅读分类。这种表意文字的基本（一级）等于和高于相应的汉字音节（二级）。

trans-unit.source: [3] Perl has \d\D\s\S\w\W\X[:prop:][:^prop:], plus all the properties specified by https://www.unicode.org/reports/tr18/#Compatibility_Properties. These are described above in "Other Properties"
trans-unit.target: [3] Perl具有 \d \D \s \S \w \W \X [:prop:] [:^prop:] ，以及由https://www.unicode.org/reports/tr18指定的所有属性/＃Compatibility_Properties。这些在上面的“其他属性”中进行了描述。

trans-unit.source: [3] zh__pinyin, zh__stroke and zh__zhuyin: implemented alt='short', where a smaller number of ideographs are tailored.
trans-unit.target: [3]拼音，笔画和注音：已实现alt ='short'，其中定制了较少的表意文字。

trans-unit.source: [5] \b\B meet most, but not all, the details of this requirement, but \b{wb} and \B{wb} do, as well as the stricter R2.3.
trans-unit.target: [5] \b \B 满足此要求的大部分（但不是全部）细节，但是 \b{wb} 和 \B{wb} 以及更严格的R2.3都能满足。

trans-unit.target: [8] Perl中使用的UTF-8 / UTF-EBDDIC不仅允许 U+10000 至 U+10FFFF ,而且允许超出 U+10FFFF

trans-unit.source: [9] Unicode has rewritten this portion of UTS#18 to say that getting canonical equivalence (see UAX#15 "Unicode Normalization Forms") is basically to be done at the programmer level. Use NFD to write both your regular expressions and text to match them against (you can use Unicode::Normalize).
trans-unit.target: [9] Unicode重写了UTS＃18的这一部分，以说获得规范的等效性（请参阅UAX＃15 “ Unicode规范化形式”）基本上是在程序员级别完成的。使用NFD编写正则表达式和文本以使其匹配（可以使用Unicode :: Normalize）。

trans-unit.source: [CORE] Converts the supplied Win32 error number (e.g. returned by Win32::GetLastError()) to a descriptive string. Analogous to the perror() standard-C library function. Note that $^E used in a string context has much the same effect.
trans-unit.target: [CORE]将提供的Win32错误号（例如Win32 :: GetLastError（）返回）转换为描述性字符串。类似于perror（）标准C库函数。注意，在字符串上下文中使用的 $^E 具有相同的效果。

trans-unit.source: [CORE] GetFullPathName combines the FILENAME with the current drive and directory name and returns a fully qualified (aka, absolute) path name. In list context it returns two elements: (PATH, FILE) where PATH is the complete pathname component (including trailing backslash) and FILE is just the filename part. Note that no attempt is made to convert 8.3 components in the supplied FILENAME to longnames or vice-versa. Compare with Win32::GetShortPathName() and Win32::GetLongPathName().
trans-unit.target: [CORE] GetFullPathName将FILENAME与当前驱动器和目录名称结合在一起，并返回完全限定的（也就是绝对的）路径名。在列表上下文中，它返回两个元素：（PATH，FILE），其中PATH是完整的路径名组件（包括尾部反斜杠），而FILE只是文件名部分。请注意，不会尝试将提供的FILENAME中的8.3组件转换为长名称，反之亦然。与Win32 :: GetShortPathName（）和Win32 :: GetLongPathName（）比较。

trans-unit.source: [CORE] Pauses for TIME milliseconds. The timeslices are made available to other processes and threads.
trans-unit.target: [CORE]暂停了TIME毫秒。时间片可用于其他进程和线程。

trans-unit.source: [CORE] Returns a representation of PATHNAME composed of longname components (if any). The result may not necessarily be longer than PATHNAME. No attempt is made to convert PATHNAME to the absolute path. Compare with Win32::GetShortPathName() and Win32::GetFullPathName().
trans-unit.target: [CORE]返回由长名称组件（如果有）组成的PATHNAME的表示形式。结果可能不一定长于PATHNAME。没有尝试将PATHNAME转换为绝对路径。与Win32 :: GetShortPathName（）和Win32 :: GetFullPathName（）比较。

trans-unit.source: [CORE] Returns a representation of PATHNAME that is composed of short (8.3) path components where available. For path components where the file system has not generated the short form the returned path will use the long form, so this function might still for instance return a path containing spaces. Returns undef when the PATHNAME does not exist. Compare with Win32::GetFullPathName() and Win32::GetLongPathName().
trans-unit.target: [CORE]返回PATHNAME的表示形式，该表示形式由短（8.3）路径组件（如果有）组成。对于文件系统尚未生成短格式的路径组件，返回的路径将使用长格式，因此该函数可能仍会例如返回包含空格的路径。当PATHNAME不存在时，返回 undef 。与Win32 :: GetFullPathName（）和Win32 :: GetLongPathName（）比较。

trans-unit.source: [CORE] Returns a string in the form of "<d>:" where <d> is the first available drive letter.
trans-unit.target: [CORE]返回形式为“ <d>：”的字符串，其中<d>是第一个可用的驱动器号。

[CORE] Returns non zero if the Win32 subsystem is Windows NT.

trans-unit.source: [CORE] Returns the Microsoft Network node-name of the current machine.
trans-unit.target: [CORE]返回当前计算机的Microsoft网络节点名称。

trans-unit.source: [CORE] Returns the current active drive and directory. This function does not return a UNC path, since the functionality required for such a feature is not available under Windows 95.
trans-unit.target: [CORE]返回当前的活动驱动器和目录。此功能不会返回UNC路径，因为Windows 95下没有此功能所需的功能。

trans-unit.source: [CORE] Returns the last error value generated by a call to a Win32 API function. Note that $^E used in a numeric context amounts to the same value.
trans-unit.target: [CORE]返回通过调用Win32 API函数生成的最后一个错误值。请注意，在数字上下文中使用的 $^E 等于相同的值。

trans-unit.source: [CORE] Returns the list (STRING, MAJOR, MINOR, BUILD, ID), where the elements are, respectively: An arbitrary descriptive string, the major version number of the operating system, the minor version number, the build number, and a digit indicating the actual operating system. For the ID, the values are 0 for Win32s, 1 for Windows 9X/Me and 2 for Windows NT/2000/XP/2003/Vista/2008/7. In scalar context it returns just the ID.
trans-unit.target: [CORE]返回列表（STRING，MAJOR，MINOR，BUILD，ID），其中的元素分别是：任意描述性字符串，操作系统的主要版本号，次要版本号，内部版本号和指示实际操作系统的数字。对于ID，对于Win32，值为0；对于Windows 9X / Me，值为1；对于Windows NT / 2000 / XP / 2003 / Vista / 2008/7，值为2。在标量上下文中，它仅返回ID。

trans-unit.source: [CORE] Returns the name of the Microsoft Network domain or workgroup that the owner of the current perl process is logged into. The "Workstation" service must be running to determine this information. This function does not work on Windows 9x.
trans-unit.target: [CORE]返回当前perl进程的所有者登录的Microsoft网络域或工作组的名称。必须运行“工作站”服务才能确定此信息。此功能无法在Windows 9x工作。

trans-unit.source: [CORE] Returns the name of the filesystem of the currently active drive (like 'FAT' or 'NTFS'). In list context it returns three values: (FSTYPE, FLAGS, MAXCOMPLEN). FSTYPE is the filesystem type as before. FLAGS is a combination of values of the following table:
trans-unit.target: [CORE]返回当前活动驱动器的文件系统名称（如“ FAT”或“ NTFS”）。在列表上下文中，它返回三个值：（FSTYPE，FLAGS，MAXCOMPLEN）。FSTYPE是以前的文件系统类型。FLAGS是下表的值的组合：

trans-unit.source: [CORE] Returns the number of milliseconds elapsed since the last system boot. Resolution is limited to system timer ticks (about 10ms on WinNT and 55ms on Win9X).
trans-unit.target: [CORE]返回自上次系统引导以来经过的毫秒数。分辨率仅限于系统计时器滴答（在WinNT上约为10毫秒，在Win9X上约为55毫秒）。

trans-unit.source: [CORE] Returns the username of the owner of the current perl process. The return value may be a Unicode string.
trans-unit.target: [CORE]返回当前Perl进程所有者的用户名。返回值可以是Unicode字符串。

trans-unit.source: [CORE] Sets the current active drive and directory. This function does not work with UNC paths, since the functionality required to required for such a feature is not available under Windows 95.
trans-unit.target: [CORE]设置当前的活动驱动器和目录。此功能不适用于UNC路径，因为Windows 95下没有此功能所需的功能。

trans-unit.source: [CORE] Sets the value of the last error encountered to ERROR. This is that value that will be returned by the Win32::GetLastError() function.
trans-unit.target: [CORE]将遇到的最后一个错误的值设置为ERROR。这就是Win32 :: GetLastError（）函数将返回的值。

trans-unit.source: [CORE] Spawns a new process using the supplied COMMAND, passing in arguments in the string ARGS. The pid of the new process is stored in PID. This function is deprecated. Please use the Win32::Process module instead.
trans-unit.target: [CORE]使用提供的COMMAND生成新进程，并在字符串ARGS中传入参数。新进程的pid存储在PID中。不推荐使用此功能。请改为使用Win32 :: Process模块​​。

trans-unit.source: [CORE] The Win32::CopyFile() function copies an existing file to a new file. All file information like creation time and file attributes will be copied to the new file. However it will not copy the security information. If the destination file already exists it will only be overwritten when the OVERWRITE parameter is true. But even this will not overwrite a read-only file; you have to unlink() it first yourself.
trans-unit.target: [CORE] Win32 :: CopyFile（）函数将现有文件复制到新文件。所有文件信息（如创建时间和文件属性）都将复制到新文件中。但是，它不会复制安全信息。如果目标文件已经存在，则仅当OVERWRITE参数为true时，才会覆盖目标文件。但是，即使这样也不会覆盖只读文件。您必须自己先将其unlink（）断开。

trans-unit.source: [MAYCHANGE] In other words, the array or hash fetch/store functions don't really fetch and store actual values in the case of tied arrays and hashes. They merely call mg_copy to attach magic to the values that were meant to be "stored" or "fetched". Later calls to mg_get and mg_set actually do the job of invoking the TIE methods on the underlying objects. Thus the magic mechanism currently implements a kind of lazy access to arrays and hashes.
trans-unit.target: [MAYCHANGE]换句话说，在绑定数组和哈希的情况下，数组或哈希获取/存储函数实际上并不获取和存储实际值。他们仅调用 mg_copy 将魔术附加到本应“存储”或“获取”的值上。以后对 mg_get 和 mg_set 的调用实际上完成了在基础对象上调用TIE方法的工作。因此，魔术机制当前实现了对数组和哈希的一种惰性访问。

trans-unit.source: `Memoizing' a function makes it faster by trading space for time. It does this by caching the return values of the function in a table. trans-unit.target: “记忆”功能可以通过交换时间来使其更快。它通过在表中缓存函数的返回值来实现。如果再次使用相同的参数调用该函数，则 memoize 会跳转并为您提供表中的值，而不是让该函数重新计算该值。

trans-unit.source: an xV that is mortal, and it is possible for there to be more than one mortal reference to a single xV. For a reference to be mortal means that it is owned by the temps stack, one of perl's many internal stacks, which will destroy that reference "a short time later". Usually the "short time later" is the end of the current Perl statement. However, it gets more complicated around dynamic scopes: there can be multiple sets of mortal references hanging around at the same time, with different death dates. Internally, the actual determinant for when mortal xV references are destroyed depends on two macros, SAVETMPS and FREETMPS. See perlcall and perlxs and "Temporaries Stack" below for more details on these macros.
trans-unit.target: 一个xV是致命的，并且可能对一个xV有多个不止一个致命的引用。凡人引用都意味着它是由temps堆栈拥有的，而temps堆栈是perl的许多内部堆栈之一，这将在“不久之后”销毁该引用。通常，“稍后很短的时间”是当前Perl语句的结尾。但是，它在动态范围内变得更加复杂：可以同时存在多组具有不同死亡日期的凡人引用。在内部，何时销毁致命xV引用的实际决定因素取决于两个宏SAVETMPS和FREETMPS。有关这些宏的更多详细信息，请参见下面的perlcall和perlxs和“临时堆栈”。

trans-unit.source: and the old 5.005 style threading, or for that matter, to most other threading systems out there, is that by default, no data is shared. When a new Perl thread is created, all the data associated with the current thread is copied to the new thread, and is subsequently private to that new thread! This is similar in feel to what happens when a Unix process forks, except that in this case, the data is just copied to a different part of memory within the same process rather than a real fork taking place.
trans-unit.target: 和旧的5.005风格的线程,或者说,对于大多数其他线程系统来说,默认情况下,没有数据是共享的。当一个新的Perl线程被创建时,所有与当前线程相关的数据都会被复制到新线程中,并且随后成为新线程的私有数据!这与Unix进程分叉时的感觉类似。这和 Unix 进程分叉时的感觉很相似,只是在这种情况下,数据只是被复制到了同一个进程的内存中的不同部分,而不是真正的分叉。

trans-unit.source: and when compiling the POSIX extension

and will die if a character larger than 255 is written to the handle. When reading, each octet from the handle becomes a byte-in-a-character. Note that this default is the same behaviour as bytes-only languages (including Perl before v5.6) would have, and is sufficient to handle native 8-bit encodings e.g. iso-8859-1, EBCDIC etc. and any legacy mechanisms for handling other encodings and binary data.
trans-unit.target: 如果将大于255的字符写入句柄，则会 die 。读取时，句柄中的每个八位位组都变成一个字节字符。请注意，此默认行为与纯字节语言（包括v5.6之前的Perl）具有相同的行为，并且足以处理本机8位编码，例如iso-8859-1，EBCDIC等，以及任何用于处理的旧机制其他编码和二进制数据。
